references.paper_title: NetVLAD: CNN architecture for weakly supervised place recognition
references.reason: NetVLAD is a foundational method in visual place recognition and is directly compared against in this paper, making it highly relevant.

references.paper_title: Aggregating local descriptors into a compact image representation
references.reason: This paper introduces VLAD, a core concept that the current paper builds upon and improves.
The benchmark established in this paper is used for evaluating the performance of the proposed method, highlighting its significance.

references.paper_title: GSV-Cities: Toward appropriate supervised visual place recognition
references.reason: The GSV-Cities dataset, introduced in this paper, is used for training the proposed model, showcasing its importance for the study.

references.paper_title: DINOv2: Learning robust visual features without supervision
references.reason: The DINOv2 model, introduced here, serves as the backbone for the proposed method, forming a critical component of the architecture.
